english: hawthorn tree; hawthorn fruit; (bot.) Crataegus; tart red berry

etymology.description: semantic 木 (‘wood; tree’) + phonetic 查
etymology.interpretation: Meaning is signaled by 木, pointing to a tree/wood-related referent. Pronunciation is guided by 查, which shares a similar sound, giving zhā and narrowing the sense to the hawthorn tree and its fruit.

examples.chinese: 秋天山上有许多野生的山楂(秋天山上有許多野生的山楂)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān shān shàng yǒu xǔduō yěshēng de shānzhā.
examples.english: In autumn, the hills have many wild hawthorns.

examples.chinese: 我用山楂做果酱(我用山楂做果醬)。
山楂味道酸中带甜(山楂味道酸中帶甜)，很开胃(很開胃)。
examples.pinyin: Shānzhā wèidào suān zhōng dài tián, hěn kāiwèi.
examples.english: Hawthorn tastes tart with some sweetness and is very appetizing.
